text: last fit get metrics

title: Do the last fit and get the metrics — last_metrics
Do the last fit and get the metrics — last_metrics
text: res Tune results split initial split object metric metric use select best workflow

title: Do the last fit and get the metrics — last_metrics
code: library(tidymodels) #> ── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels 1.2.0 ── #> ✔ broom        1.0.6     ✔ recipes      1.1.0 #> ✔ dials        1.3.0     ✔ rsample      1.2.1 #> ✔ dplyr        1.1.4     ✔ tibble       3.2.1 #> ✔ ggplot2      3.5.1     ✔ tidyr        1.3.1 #> ✔ infer        1.0.7     ✔ tune         1.2.1 #> ✔ modeldata    1.4.0     ✔ workflows    1.1.4 #> ✔ parsnip      1.2.1     ✔ workflowsets 1.1.0 #> ✔ purrr        1.0.2     ✔ yardstick    1.3.1 #> ── Conflicts ───────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels_conflicts() ── #> ✖ purrr::discard() masks scales::discard() #> ✖ dplyr::filter()  masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()     masks stats::lag() #> ✖ recipes::step()  masks stats::step() #> • Use tidymodels_prefer() to resolve common conflicts. library(xgboost) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘xgboost’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:dplyr’: #>  #>     slice library(modeldata) data(cells) split <- cells |>   mutate(across(where(is.character), as.factor)) |>   sample_n(500) |>   initial_split(strata = class) train <- training(split) folds <- vfold_cv(train, v = 2, strata = class) wf <- train |>   recipe(case ~ .) |>   step_integer(all_nominal_predictors()) |>   workflow_boost_tree() res <- wf |>   tune_grid(     folds,     grid = 2,     metrics = metric_set(roc_auc),     control = control_grid(save_workflow = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)   ) #> i Creating pre-processing data to finalize unknown parameter: mtry res |> collect_metrics() #> # A tibble: 2 × 13 #>    mtry trees min_n tree_depth learn_rate loss_reduction sample_size .metric #>   <int> <int> <int>      <int>      <dbl>          <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>   #> 1    10  1958    16          9    0.00214  0.00000000103       0.707 roc_auc #> 2    43   510    39          3    0.0765   1.91                0.521 roc_auc #> # ℹ 5 more variables: .estimator <chr>, mean <dbl>, n <int>, std_err <dbl>, #> #   .config <chr> res |> last_metrics(split, "roc_auc") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   .metric     .estimator .estimate .config              #>   <chr>       <chr>          <dbl> <chr>                #> 1 accuracy    binary         0.5   Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 roc_auc     binary         0.5   Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 3 brier_class binary         0.250 Preprocessor1_Model1 best <- res |> fit_best() best |>   augment(testing(split)) |>   roc_auc(case, .pred_Test) |>   pull(.estimate) #> [1] 0.5

text: x object fun_list list functions run parallel object

title: Map parallel processing — mapParallel
text: mapParallel function uses parallel package run functions run parallel object. returning anything.

title: Map parallel processing — mapParallel
code: data.frame(x = 2) |> mapParallel(list(function(x) print(x), function(x) print(x * 2))) #>   x #> 1 2 #>   x #> 1 4

what: Make a sound and send an email when a process finished — notify_finished
title: Make a sound and send an email when a process finished — notify_finished
text: notify_finished make sound using beepr::beep, compose email send returing   blastula::smtp_send call results.

title: Make a sound and send an email when a process finished — notify_finished
Make a sound and send an email when a process finished — notify_finished
text: name process name (Required) body contents email (Default "") ... Additional arguments pass template function. using default template, can use font_family control base font, content_width control width main content; see blastula_template(). default, content_width set ⁠1000px⁠. Using widths less ⁠600px⁠ generally advised , necessary, sure test HTML emails wide range email clients sending intended recipients. Outlook mail client (Windows, Desktop) respect content_width. sound sound beepr::beep call (Default 1) tictoc_result result tictoc::toc (Default NULL)

title: Make a sound and send an email when a process finished — notify_finished
text: following environment variables set: MY_SMTP_USER MY_SMTP_RECIPIENT MY_SMTP_PASSWORD service password (gmail can use https://myaccount.google.com/apppasswords) MY_SMTP_PROVIDER blastula provider (gmail set)

title: Make a sound and send an email when a process finished — notify_finished
code: if (exists("not_run")) {   tictoc::tic()   Sys.sleep(1)   jrrosell::notify_finished("job", "Well done", sound = "fanfare", tictoc_result = tictoc::toc()) }

text: file Either path file, connection, literal data (either single string raw vector). delim Single character used separate fields within record. locale locale controls defaults vary place place. default locale US-centric (like R), can use locale() create locale controls things like default time zone, encoding, decimal mark, big mark, day/month names. ... parameters readr::read_delim.

title: Start parallel processing — startParallel
text: Start timer parallel processing max/min available cores.

title: Start parallel processing — startParallel
Start parallel processing — startParallel
text: msg character vector tictoc timer message. max integer max desired cores. min integer min desired cores.

title: Start parallel processing — startParallel
text: startParallel function uses tictoc, parallelly, parallel packages. returns parallel cluster passed stopParallel argument

title: Start parallel processing — startParallel
code: cl <- startParallel("parallel processing", max = 3, min = 1) print("parallel processing here") #> [1] "parallel processing here" stopParallel(cl) #> parallel processing: 0.002 sec elapsed

title: Stop parallel processing — stopParallel
text: Stop started timer parallel processing.

title: Stop parallel processing — stopParallel
Stop parallel processing — stopParallel
text: cl cluster object returned startParallel parallel::makeCluster, parallel::makePSOCKcluster, parallel::makeForkCluster

title: Stop parallel processing — stopParallel
text: stopParallel function uses tictoc  parallel packages. returns result parallel::stopCluster(cl) method.

title: Stop parallel processing — stopParallel
code: cl <- startParallel() print("parallel processing here") #> [1] "parallel processing here" stopParallel(cl) #> 0.001 sec elapsed

Update recipe step values by id — update_step
text: object recipe workflow object recipe target_id id name step ... arguments update step.

title: Update recipe step values by id — update_step
code: recipes::recipe(spray ~ ., data = InsectSprays) |>   recipes::step_ns(count, deg_free = hardhat::tune(), id = "ns") |>   update_step("ns", deg_free = 1) #>  #> ── Recipe ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Inputs  #> Number of variables by role #> outcome:   1 #> predictor: 1 #>  #> ── Operations  #> • Natural splines on: count

what: Create an xgboost tunable workflow for regression and classification — workflow_boost_tree
title: Create an xgboost tunable workflow for regression and classification — workflow_boost_tree
text: Create xgboost tunable workflow regression classification

title: Create an xgboost tunable workflow for regression and classification — workflow_boost_tree
Create an xgboost tunable workflow for regression and classification — workflow_boost_tree
text: rec prerocessing recipe build workflow engine optional, xgboost default counts Optional logic argument wether mtry use counts ... optional engine arguments

title: Create an xgboost tunable workflow for regression and classification — workflow_boost_tree
code: library(tidymodels) library(xgboost) library(modeldata) library(future) data(cells) split <- cells |>   mutate(across(where(is.character), as.factor)) |>   sample_n(500) |>   initial_split(strata = class) train <- training(split) folds <- vfold_cv(train, v = 2, strata = class) wf <- train |>   recipe(case ~ .) |>   step_integer(all_nominal_predictors()) |>   workflow_boost_tree() doFuture::registerDoFuture() plan(sequential) res <- wf |>   tune_grid(     folds,     grid = 2,     metrics = metric_set(roc_auc),     control = control_grid(save_workflow = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)   ) #> i Creating pre-processing data to finalize unknown parameter: mtry res |> collect_metrics() #> # A tibble: 2 × 13 #>    mtry trees min_n tree_depth learn_rate loss_reduction sample_size .metric #>   <int> <int> <int>      <int>      <dbl>          <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>   #> 1    20   824    32          4    0.00179       1.14e- 3       0.428 roc_auc #> 2    46  1744     5          8    0.0434        1.36e-10       0.582 roc_auc #> # ℹ 5 more variables: .estimator <chr>, mean <dbl>, n <int>, std_err <dbl>, #> #   .config <chr> res |> last_metrics(split, "roc_auc") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   .metric     .estimator .estimate .config              #>   <chr>       <chr>          <dbl> <chr>                #> 1 accuracy    binary         0.484 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 roc_auc     binary         0.454 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 3 brier_class binary         0.352 Preprocessor1_Model1 best <- res |> fit_best() best |>   augment(testing(split)) |>   roc_auc(case, .pred_Test) |>   pull(.estimate) #> [1] 0.4431847

what: Create a tuneable glmnet worfklow for regression and classification — workflow_elasticnet
title: Create a tuneable glmnet worfklow for regression and classification — workflow_elasticnet
text: Create tuneable glmnet worfklow regression classification

title: Create a tuneable glmnet worfklow for regression and classification — workflow_elasticnet
Create a tuneable glmnet worfklow for regression and classification — workflow_elasticnet
text: rec prerocessing recipe build workflow engine optional, glmnet default ... Optional engine arguments

title: Create a tuneable glmnet worfklow for regression and classification — workflow_elasticnet
code: library(tidymodels) library(glmnet) #> Loading required package: Matrix #>  #> Attaching package: ‘Matrix’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:tidyr’: #>  #>     expand, pack, unpack #> Loaded glmnet 4.1-8 library(modeldata) library(future) data(cells) split <- cells |>   mutate(across(where(is.character), as.factor)) |>   sample_n(500) |>   initial_split(strata = class) train <- training(split) folds <- vfold_cv(train, v = 2, strata = class) wf <- train |>   recipe(case ~ .) |>   step_integer(all_nominal_predictors()) |>   workflow_elasticnet() #> [1] "logistic_reg binary clssification" doFuture::registerDoFuture() plan(sequential) res <- wf |>   tune_grid(     folds,     grid = 2,     metrics = metric_set(roc_auc),     control = control_grid(save_workflow = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)   ) res |> collect_metrics() #> # A tibble: 2 × 8 #>      penalty mixture .metric .estimator  mean     n std_err .config              #>        <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>      <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>                #> 1 0.000130     0.469 roc_auc binary     0.487     2  0.0257 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 0.00000490   0.814 roc_auc binary     0.487     2  0.0265 Preprocessor1_Model2 res |> last_metrics(split, "roc_auc") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   .metric     .estimator .estimate .config              #>   <chr>       <chr>          <dbl> <chr>                #> 1 accuracy    binary         0.492 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 2 roc_auc     binary         0.514 Preprocessor1_Model1 #> 3 brier_class binary         0.285 Preprocessor1_Model1 best <- res |> fit_best() best |>   augment(testing(split)) |>   roc_auc(case, .pred_Test) |>   pull(.estimate) #> [1] 0.5138889

title: Write a list of tibbles to a xlsx file — write_xlsx
text: write_xlsx wroapper openxls::write.xlsx.

title: Write a list of tibbles to a xlsx file — write_xlsx
code: l <- list("IRIS" = iris, "MTCATS" = mtcars, matrix(runif(1000), ncol = 5)) write_xlsx(l, "/tmp/writeList1.xlsx", colWidths = c(NA, "auto", "auto")) file.remove("/tmp/writeList1.xlsx") #> [1] TRUE
